issue.description:
Page 16 section 4.2.4.3 Status The status of an approval is supposed to be "approved" or "not approved" according to the object description page 16 while page 176 proposes 4 approval status in the AIM: "approved", "not yet approved"; "disapproved" and "withdrawn".
Suggested solution: The text page 16 should be changed to be consistent with the AIM.
Page 23 section 4.2.19.4 Part_type The description of the possible part_types are not consistent with what is said page 153. In particular, the "customer supplied material" must be replaced by "customer furnished equipment"; and the part_type value "government" is not existing in the AIM rule of pages 152 and 153. Suggested solution Modify the text of the section 4.2.19.4 so that it is consistent with the authorized values in pages 152 and 153.
Page 36 section 4.3.23 Assertion from Product_configuration to Part. The assertion indicates a relationship from Product_configuration to Part while it should be from Product_configuration to Part_version.
Suggested solution: Change the assertion. The mapping table and the AIM are already reflecting the corrected assertion.
Page 54 mapping of Change date Date_time_role.name ='change_date' is not compliant with the rule 52 "restrict_date_time_role" page 186.
Suggested solution: Modify the role 'change_date' by 'start_date' in the mapping table to be consistent with the rule 52.
Page 75 mapping of standard_part_indicator The attribute related_product_category and relating_product_category have been replaced in the entity product_category_relationship by subcategory and category. Suggested solution: Modify attributes names in the mapping according to the part 41 definition.
Page 88 Rule 37 The name of the rule 37 is acu_requires_security_classification and not pdu_requires_security_classification as it is written.

comment.description:
This SEDS was raised against AP203 edition 1 and was closed in edition 2. 1. Approval status has been made generic, so the terms are not restricted to a particular set. 2. Part is now defined as a subtype of Product, so the mappings and values have changed accordingly 3. The mappings now reflect the new edition of Part41 4. The typo for the rule acu_requries_security_classification has been corrected.
The modules affected by this SEDs are:
Approval, part_and_version_identification, part_view_definition, and configuration_control_3d_design

issue.description:
This global rule is not sufficient because it allows to create a complex instance of two or several subtypes of shape_representation, provided the items of the representation are only axis2_placement or provided the instance is a representation of a shape_aspect or of a shape_aspect_relationship.
I think the intent of the protocol (as explicited in the conformance classes) is to allow simple instances of only one of the 7 subtypes of shape_representation. Additionally, the definition of these 7 subtypes is such that they all may contain axis2_placement_3D instances as items. Finally, I do not see why a shape_aspect or a shape_aspect_relationship should be allowed to be represented by a complex instance of several subtypes of shape_representation. Therefore, I consider the rule should be improved.

comment.description: The rule was removed from edition 2. This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was closed in edition 2.

issue.description: The RULE subtype_mandatory_shape_representation does not allow use founding of cartesian_transformation_operators to support use of functional transforms supporting assembly representation

comment.description: This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was removed from edition 2.

issue.description:
Application Assertion 4.3.2, Approval to Person_organization, is not implemented completely in the AIM. In particular, rules 5.2.4.31, approvals_are_assigned, and 5.2.4.32, approval_requires_approval_person_organization are not sufficient to implement the part of 4.3.2 that asserts "Each Approval is authorized by one or many Person_organization objects."
Since there is no rule requiring person_and_organization to be assigned by person_and_organization_assignment\ cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment, the AIM allows the possibility that a person_and_organization instance associated with a cc_design_approval instance may be assigned by zero cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment instances, in violation of 4.3.2 as implemented in 5.1, Mapping table.

comment.description: This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was added to edition 2.

issue.description:
Application Assertion 4.3.39, Work_request to Person_organization, is not implemented completely in the AIM. In particular, rules 5.2.4.7, change_request_requires_person_organization, and 5.2.4.12, start_request_requires_person_organization are not sufficient to implement the part of 4.3.39 that asserts "Each Work_request notice is received by one or many Person_organization objects."
There are no rules in the AIM requiring that versioned_action_request (AIM representation of Work_Request) be referenced by any action_request_assignment (AIM representation of Change_Request and Start_Request). Therefore, the AIM allows the possibility that a versioned_action_request instance may be received by by zero cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment instances, in violation of 4.3.39 as implemented in 5.1, Mapping table.

comment.description: This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was added to edition 2.

issue.description:
Application Assertion 4.3.39, Work_request to Person_organization, is not implemented completely in the AIM. In particular, rules 5.2.4.7, change_request_requires_person_organization, and 5.2.4.12, start_request_requires_person_organization are not sufficient to implement the part of 4.3.39 that asserts "Each Work_request notice is received by one or many Person_organization objects."
There are no rules in the AIM requiring that versioned_action_request (AIM representation of Work_Request) be referenced by any action_request_assignment (AIM representation of Change_Request and Start_Request). Therefore, the AIM allows the possibility that a versioned_action_request instance may be received by by zero cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment instances, in violation of 4.3.39 as implemented in 5.1, Mapping table.

comment.description: This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was added to edition 2.

issue.description:
Application Assertion 4.3.2, Approval to Person_organization, is not implemented completely in the AIM. In particular, rules 5.2.4.31, approvals_are_assigned, and 5.2.4.32, approval_requires_approval_person_organization are not sufficient to implement the part of 4.3.2 that asserts "Each Approval is authorized by one or many Person_organization objects."
Since there is no rule requiring person_and_organization to be assigned by person_and_organization_assignment\cc_design_person_and_organization_assig nment, the AIM allows the possibility that a person_and_organization instance associated with a cc_design_approval instance may be assigned by zero cc_design_person_and_organization_assignment instances, in violation of 4.3.2 as implemented in 5.1, Mapping table.

comment.description: This seds was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was added to edition 2.

issue.description: An expression in the last line of RULE subtype_mandatory_shape_representation, clause WR1 is not of the proper type. The expression "sdr.definition" should instead be "sdr.definition.definition" so that the containing expression is meaningful.

comment.description: This SEDs was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The rule was deleted.

issue.description: The short form for ISO 10303-203 AM1 (ISO TC184/SC4/WG3 N915) includes in a USE FROM statement the function using_representations. The same is documented in clause 5.2 of the amended standard. According to ISO 10303-11 clause 11.1 USE FROM shall not contain references to functions. Only REFERENCE FROM may interface functions.

comment.description: This SEDs was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The issue was identified as closed by the author.

issue.description:
The long form of ISO 10303-203AM1 (WG3N916) includes: TYPE characterized_definition = SELECT (characterized_product_definition, shape_definition); END_TYPE; -- characterized_definition
The same is the case in the IS pdf-file.
However, characterized_product_definition is not used in the long form else. It should be removed from the long form, i.e., this should have happened during the generation of the long form from the short form (WG3N915).
Another however: The pdf-file states in clause 5.2.1.1: "The product_definition_shape entity is constrained to use the characterized_product_definition select type." This statement seems not to be reflected in the Express schema. The declaration for product_definition_shape is: ENTITY product_definition_shape SUBTYPE OF (property_definition); UNIQUE ur1 : definition; WHERE wr1: (NOT ('CONFIG_CONTROL_DESIGN.SHAPE_DEFINITION' IN TYPEOF(SELF\ property_definition.definition))); END_ENTITY; -- product_definition_shape

comment.description: This SEDs was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The issue was identified as closed by the author.
This SEDs was raised against 203 edition 1 and was addressed in edition 2. The issue was identified as closed by the author.

issue.description: When exchanging shape representation, it would vastly extend the usability of the information if some basic graphic attributes could be included. Such inclusions would be used for the CRT display of results, and not for drafting. In addition, many users of CAD systems today use a concept called significant layering. While this is basically a form of semantic overloading on the CAD system's attribute, it is widely enough used that preserving this option has merit. Note that this is specifically not a request to include the semantics which various users overload on layers, just to include layers as a graphic attribute which the user can continue to abuse in a way which has proven useful.

comment.description: An additional graphic is not appropriate.

comment.description: Fixed. Also added numerous other missing mim schemas.

issue.description: Need proper mapping for subtype constraint.
Not clear why Time_interval is assigned to time_interval_effectivity, hence why Time_interval_item_203e2 is needed, nor USE FROM Time_interval_assignment.
direction_shape_representation is mentioned in rule subtype_exclusiveness_representation WR1 but is not in the schema nor in a module.

comment.description: It comes from AP214 clause 5.2.3.1.54 --- it is just a direction vector (2 or 3D) just like in Part 42, BUT someone needed it to be a subtype of shape_representation it seems.

restrict_applied_action_assignment has WR7 but not 1-6
restrict_organization_assignment WR3 lists PROPERTY_DEFINITION but words incude action_property, resource_property, or property_definition

comment.description: Checks performed by stepmod xsl style sheets.

issue.description: RULE subtype_exclusiveness_representation EXPRESS and description are not consistent.
subtype_exclusiveness_representation_item.wr:WR1 refers to rep_item_group which is not in the module schema, nor in any mim or aic. It is in automotive_design.
Wording of description not correct.
Replace all occurrences of schema_name with CONFIGURATION_CONTROL_3D_DESIGN_ED2_MIM, per convener direction. This integration mechanism is obsolete.
Replace occurrences in strings of AUTOMOTIVE_DESIGN with CONFIGURATION_CONTROL_3D_DESIGN_ED2_MIM

Annex E mim long form EXPRESS A comparison between the longform of AP203 Ed2 and the longform of the PDMschema V1.2 resulted in some major differences in the two EXPRESS schemas. These differences lead to problems in the implementations of already available STEP processors and therefore hinders the interoperability of industrial STEP applications. Modify the underlying modules in order to derive a longform of AP203 Ed2 which is compatible with the PDM schema V1.2

comment.description: Issue was resolved by created module 10303-1231 Product_data_management. The contents were agreed with PDM-IF, AP214, AP239, and AP203, and major customers of PDM schema. Contents include minor increases in scope of PDM, to avoid futher fragmenation of modules.

issue.description: Annex E mim long form EXPRESS A comparison between the longform of AP203 Ed2 and the longform of ISO 10303-214 conformance class 6 resulted in some major differences in the two EXPRESS schemas. These differences lead to problems in the implementations of already available STEP processors and therefore hinders the interoperability of industrial STEP applications. Modify the underlying modules in order to derive a longform of AP203 Ed2 which is compatible with the ISO 10303-214 CC6

comment.description: Remaining issues concern 10303-1003 curve appearance. These will be addressed in DIS with a new edition of 10303-1003.

issue.description: Annex E mim long form EXPRESS The longform of AP203 Ed2 contains some EXPRESS errors and does no obey the rules defined in ISO 10303-11:2003 for generating an EXPRESS longform from the shortform. Correct the EXPRESS schema for the longform according to ISO 10303-11:2003 (may require changes to the short form as well)

comment.description: Express has been recompiled and rechecked.

issue.description: Annex E The MIM longform contains errors. A new longform needs to be generated with the correct SHOTOLO algorithm.

In order to understand the arm concepts, the reader has to navigate through dozens of unconnected ARM diagrams. Find a way to integrate the ARM diagrams into a coherent model. Use the high-level planning model ideas in comments US-4, 5, and 6.

comment.description: AP203 modufied to use same structure as AP239, as agreed in SC4 ballot comments workshops.

issue.description: In order to follow the mapping concepts, one has to navigate through all the lower level modules. There is no longer a grouping by UoF Develop some sort of summary mapping specification. Implement implementation modules that are built from functional groupings in the high-level planning model.

comment.description: Accept. Planning model has been added.

issue.description: A single conformance class is not useful for implementers. Develop implementation level modules based upon functional groupings from the high level planning model. Using the same diagram from the high level planning model, for each implementation module highlight the functional boxes (which are filled with the constituent module names) that belong to that implementation module.

comment.description: Accept - See DE 4 DO we need an additional collector , modules such as GDT that might not be implementable but can help form one or more Implementation modules.
AP now has three implementation modules: 403, the entire ap 203e2; 1231 analougous to pdm schema; 1230 analogous to cax-if schema

issue.description: Classification_item: currently only 4 select items are included: - dimensional_size, - document_file, - plus_minus_tolerance, - product_definition; the AP203e1 mapping requires the following: - applied_action_assignment, - applied_action_request_assignment, - configuration_design, - document, - product_definition_relationship, - product_definition_formation.

comment.description: All are now included except: - configuration_design, - document, These two are not classified_item in 203e1.

issue.description: approval_item: the mapping from AP203e1 requires additionally the following select items: - applied_action_request_assignment, - configuration_item, - security_classification.
date_and_time_item: the mapping from AP203e1 requires additionally the following select item: - applied_action_request_assignment.
person_and_organization_item: the mapping from AP203e1 requires additionally the following select item: - applied_action_request_assignment.

function value_range_aggregate_rep_item is nowhere called in long form.

comment.description: Renamed ap203_configuration_controlled_3d_design_of_mechanical_parts_and_assemblies per agreement among chair and conveners.

issue.description: Redundant USE FROM to modules in scope of 1230.

comment.description: These are to create the proper hot links.

issue.description:
Part 403 claims to define the full information model for 10303-203e2. Part 1230 and Part 1231 are subsets. However, the latter references several modules which are not referenced by the complete model defined in Part 403. E.g. Part 1230 references Assembly_structure_arm and Class_arm which are not referenced in Part 403.
Make the module references and the Annexes C of IS0 10303-403, 10303-130 and 10303-1231 consistent

comment.description: 403 has redundant interfaces. Propose to remove redundant express interfaces from 4.2 and annex c.

issue.description: mim.xml not valid because line 291 typename tag not empty
Bad header in mim.exp
